message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.CL, cs.MM

The paper deals with the problem of selecting a training dataset from big medical image data, which is a common problem in machine learning. The use of Thompson sampling to solve the multi-armed bandit problem suggests that the paper belongs to the sub-category of machine learning (cs.LG). The application of the method to brain MRI images suggests that computer vision (cs.CV) is also a likely sub-category. The use of meta information associated with the images suggests that artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and natural language processing (cs.CL) may also be relevant sub-categories. Finally, the focus on medical image data suggests that multimedia (cs.MM) may also be a relevant sub-category.
